alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 03 at 2:28PM AKST until February 04 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Point Lay and vicinity. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow are significantly reducing visibility to whiteout conditions at times. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 65 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
